Articles.Content: Hello, I'm pretty new to the forums and I'd like to know how to take and post screenshots.

To take a screenshot:  F1 (it gets put in the "Screenshots" folder of your KSP installation).  Also useful is F2, which toggles the screen UI on/off, if you want a less-cluttered screenshot.

To post a screenshot:  The easiest way is with imgur.  It's free, it doesn't make you muck around with getting an account or signing in.  Just go to imgur.com, click on "Upload Pictures", and drag your picture file into the box, then "Upload".  When it's done, right-click on the image and choose "Copy Image Location".

To insert the screenshot into your forum post, just click on the "Insert other media" button at bottom right, then choose "Insert image from URL" and paste the URL of the uploaded image.

Welcome to the forums!

There are many ways to post screenshots.  I usually have great difficulty just using the Imgur site so instead I use Flickr.  With Flickr, you upload your pics, creating an album for them in the process and also setting the copyright/license.  Then you go to your new album, click on one of hte pics, and hit the SHARE button.  This pops up a window with a row of 3 buttons on the top edge that give you different results depending on where you're posting the pic.  You want the option at the left end that just gives you a short URL.  Copy that URL to the clipboard, paste it into the forum post, and hit ENT.  Poof, picture is in post.

You can also insert entire albums into the post but all pics in the album must be public domain.
Just a question with imgur, I'm having trouble with making an album, and I don't want to post multiple links. I don't see an option to make an album though. Any tips? Thanks.

5 hours ago, batman78781 said:

Just a question with imgur, I'm having trouble with making an album, and I don't want to post multiple links. I don't see an option to make an album though. Any tips? Thanks.

If you look at the toolbar at the top, when you're making a post, way over on the right edge is a little imgur icon (white "i" with green dot on a black square)-- if you mouse over it, the tooltip is "Imgur Album".

Note, the new forum can be "funny" when it comes to YouTube and image links.  It won't process and convert the link into a preview unless you hit [enter] after pasting in the YouTube or image link.

There's also an Imgur album button in the compose toolbar (next to the Font/Size buttons), but that only wants the "code" (or unique ID) of the Imgur album.  Which is the last part of the URL (usually 5-7 alphanumeric characters).

That's probably not the right button. You want the "new post" button at the top left of the website. Once you click that, you get a "drag and drop your image here" window. Once you drop your image there, the website processes it into a proper sized image (probably jpg), and gives you a URL link to the image. You can either paste that link into your comment, or you can try to get tricky with it to have it display automatically (but that takes more steps).
